docs.text: steve martin took an extended vacation from all facets of moviemaking a few years back ; he spent this time writing essays and short stories for " the new yorker , " several of which wound up in his hilarious hardback compilation , pure drivel ( 1998 ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: much of the book spares tinseltown from mockery , although he does riff on the racist comments made by marlon brando during a larry king interview , in a fine chapter called " in search of the wily filipino . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now , as writer and star of bowfinger , he offers the masses plenty of good reasons not to pursue a career in the cinema , perhaps finally venting the frustrations ( 'everything being made now is crap' ) that led to his brief retirement from hollywood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: martin stars as bobby bowfinger , a roger corman-wannabe on the cusp of fifty and desperate for some success as a producer , quality of the projects be damned .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his accountant ( adam alexi-malle ) proposes a movie called " chubby rain , " about aliens who travel to earth in raindrops slightly fatter than regular raindrops .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bowfinger latches onto the idea immediately , and convinces his troupe of actor friends to appear in the film , based on the lie that america's top box office draw , kit ramsey ( murphy ) , has agreed to star .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ramsey , of course , wants nothing to do with such low-grade material , so bowfinger , on the thinking that action stars need to run , not speak , decides to photograph the superstar surreptitiously .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he sends his cast members ( who aren't in on it , either ; they are told ramsey hates the sight of cameras and fraternizing with his co-stars ) to ramsey's table at restaurants , asks them to follow him in parking lots , etc . , spouting script dialogue , all the while shooting the outcome from a great distance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the paranoid ramsey flees the scene nearly every time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ramsey is a member of mind head , a cultish self-help organization apparently dedicated to recruiting celebrities .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( as if that's not familiar enough , mind head guru terry stricter ( terence stamp ) has been dressed and combed to resemble l . ron hubbard , founder of scientology . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when he goes to mind head with tales of caucasian strangers appearing from nowhere to babble " white code " in his face , they fear the nervous breakdown of an important client and rush him off to a retreat , requiring bowfinger to find a stand-in .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: murphy will probably win more fans as jiff , ramsey's adorable , ignoramus double , than as kit , but it is his portrayal of the latter that took courage .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: always surrounded by an entourage , suffering from a racial inferiority complex , murphy plays right into the tabloid image of himself .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: furthermore , consider the enemies he'll make of popular scientologists .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: pacing stricter's neutral-coloured office as if on an amphetamine binge and stripped of his bigshot veneer , ramsey is asked to shout inane personal affirmations repeatedly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: murphy's scenes with stamp are exactly what i imagine of a john travolta " clearing . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not that murphy is entirely responsible for this schtick ; bowfinger is steve martin's invention .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his script is surprisingly clever as satire , given that the pseudo-religion is a sitting duck , as is the entire los angeles film industry .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( the griffin mill-types take quite a beating , in the form of robert downey jr . as bigwig jerry renfro . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: martin's decision to tell the story from a bottom feeder's point of view is what keeps it fresh and innovative-never have we seen on screen a group of people struggle this hard to complete a motion picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as expected , there are laughs only to be had insiders or buffs , such as martin's crew of mexican border-jumpers , who gain unexpected appreciation for the classics from reading " cahiers du cinema , " or martin's nonsensical explanation to dave , his loyal cinematographer ( jamie kennedy ) , that every movie , in the end , has a budget of two-thousand dollars ( ! ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: most of bowfinger is universally funny , however ; i defy any viewer to keep a straight face when christine baranski , one of our brightest comediennes , is on screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bowfinger's main flaw is a plot twist that has an insubstantial aftermath .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we're also asked to believe that a few simple close-ups of kit ramsey would redeem " chubby rain , " z-grade entertainment that would make ed wood blush .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( this aspect of bowfinger has much in common with the ludicrous oscar sequence in oz's last directorial effort , the poorly conceived in & out . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these are significant enough weaknesses that they distracted from my enjoyment of the piece .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as i mentioned at the start of this review , bowfinger offers solid reasons not to do what heather graham's character daisy does : hop a bus to hollywood in search of stardom .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that said , it offers one fantastic reason to get on that bus : the sense of community between filmmakers who gel is awesome .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: martin gets sentimental by story's end as he did in l . a . story , and how could he not ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for those who can hack it , the movies might be the greatest business in the world .
docs.label: positive
